body:
This might be already known, but I was trying to use the technique described [in the cdef classed tutorial](http://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/tutorial/cdef_classes.html) together with fused types. However, when I try to do this I get gcc errors due to duplicate members.
```python
cimport cython

cdef extern from "math.h":
    double sin(double)

cdef class Function:
    cpdef double evaluate(self, cython.floating x) except *:
        return 0

cdef class SinOfSquareFunction(Function):
    cpdef double evaluate(self, cython.floating x) except *:
        return sin(x**2)

def integrate(Function f, double a, double b, int N):
    cdef int i
    cdef double s, dx
    if f is None:
        raise ValueError("f cannot be None")
    s = 0
    dx = (b-a)/N
    for i in range(N):
        s += f.evaluate(a+i*dx)
    return s * dx

print(integrate(SinOfSquareFunction(), 0, 1, 10000))
```

results in the following gcc error:
```
$gcc -shared -pthread -fPIC -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -fno-strict-aliasing -I/usr/include/python3.6 -o testing.so testing.c
testing.c:672:12: error: duplicate member ‘__pyx_fuse_0evaluate’
   double (*__pyx_fuse_0evaluate)(struct __pyx_obj_7testing_Function *, float, int __pyx_skip_dispatch);
            ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
testing.c:673:12: error: duplicate member ‘__pyx_fuse_1evaluate’
   double (*__pyx_fuse_1evaluate)(struct __pyx_obj_7testing_Function *, double, int __pyx_skip_dispatch);
            ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```
title: Fused types do not work with extension types
